snippet: Americans increased their spending just 0.1 percent, the Commerce Department said. It was the weakest showing since January, when spending actually dropped.
abstract: Commerce Department reports consumer spending rose 0.1 percent in September, smallest gain in eight months.
lead_paragraph: Americans increased their spending just 0.1 percent, the Commerce Department said. It was the weakest showing since January, when spending actually dropped.

headline.print_headline: Consumer Spending Posts Smallest Gain in 8 Months
headline.main: Consumer Spending Posts Smallest Gain in 8 Months
